text:
In the dynamic realm of business,
where innovation races against

the clock, speed to market
has emerged as a game-changing
strategy.

Speed to market strategies
can decide whether you survive
at all or grow and thrive.

Cloud technology has democratized
product development,

making it possible for anyone
to rapidly create and launch
a product.

Small businesses can now compete
with large ones and even launch

global products with a single
click.

It also helps you streamline
your processes and make the most
of your scarce resources.

Now I'll talk about the main
aspects of the cloud that make

this possible: Real time data
visibility, automation,
and scalability.

One way cloud technologies
help you get your product

or service to market more quickly
is by helping you get better
visibility of your data.

Cloud-based systems allow you
to see data in real time from
many different sources.

This can range from what a customer
is saying about your company

on social media to whether
a manufacturing system is about
to fail.

Real time data means businesses
can make decisions in real time,

identifying gaps or opportunities,
and acting on them immediately.

A great example is Area52,
a super interesting small business
customer of AWS.

They help their customers
who are food processors
automate their factories.

Working with cloud technology,
they were able to visualize

their customer data related
to their manufacturing

processes without any complex
IT integrations.

Based on the data visualization,
they were able to identify

and create product improvements
for the factory floor.

Automation is another way that
cloud technologies can help

a small business get a jump
into the market more quickly.

Cloud-based applications
help marketing automation

practices, so you can personalize
your marketing campaigns,

better integrate activities,
and at the same time reduce
the human intervention.

This automation ensures consistent
customer experience and satisfaction.

The scalability inherent
to cloud technologies

is yet another key way that
the cloud can help you go to market
faster.

This is because it allows
you to instantly add or remove

IT resources (like computing
power, for example) to respond
to real time changes in demand.

This means that as an idea gains
traction, the necessary

resources can be allocated
promptly to meet surging

demand without compromising
on the quality of the end product.

Our customer, Fedros Avraam,
the CTO at DCC Payments,

says it better than me: "Embrace
the power of AWS, as it liberates

your business from the shackles
of on-premise infrastructure,

unlocking new horizons of scalability,
flexibility, and accelerated

growth in the digital era."
As you can see, speed to market

is no longer a mere buzzword,
but something any business

has the power to do because
of the cloud.

Think about how you might be able
to go to market faster with

the superpowers it gives you
- Real time data visibility,
automation, and scalability.
